intro: Garnotia micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved garnotia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. Garnotia micrantha is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
